Description: Tondo sherd, with turn to stem, of Attic black-figured pottery cup, possibly a Siana cup; interior, in tondo, black-figure decoration consisting of winged creature, possibly a sphinx or cock (part of wing and an arm or leg remaining; with added red and added white on wing); exterior black with trace of added red at top of stem.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the wing decoration, see Oxford AN1896-1908-G.1087.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 91 no. 312 pl. 68)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 439, no. B715, pl. XXIX, pl. CCXVII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1326) (phase 3)
